original_problem_description: A warehouse manager wants to optimize the arrangement of goods to maximize space utilization and minimize retrieval time. Each type of good has different size and accessibility requirements.

questions.vague_problem_description: A warehouse manager wants to optimize the arrangement of goods to maximize efficiency. Each type of good has different size and handling requirements.
questions.clarifying_question: What specific aspects of efficiency are we trying to maximize—is it space utilization, retrieval time, or a combination of both?

questions.vague_problem_description: A warehouse manager wants to optimize the arrangement of goods, taking into consideration the different sizes and accessibility needs.
questions.clarifying_question: Are there specific constraints on how goods can be arranged, such as weight limits on shelves, or are all configurations feasible as long as size and accessibility needs are met?

questions.vague_problem_description: A warehouse manager is looking to optimize the organization of inventory to enhance space usage and improve goods accessibility.
questions.clarifying_question: Does the manager have a priority in terms of space usage versus accessibility, or is there a particular formula for how these two factors should be balanced?
